net.sourceforge.waters.model.compiler

Class ModuleCompiler

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sourceforge.waters.model.compiler.AbortableCompiler
      • net.sourceforge.waters.model.compiler.ModuleCompiler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    net.sourceforge.waters.model.analysis.Abortable

    public class ModuleCompiler
extends AbortableCompiler

    The main tool to translate module structures into plain finite-state machines.

    The module compiler takes as input a ModuleProxy object, which may contain guards and instantiation, and converts it into a ProductDESProxy object, which is a collection of traditional DES automata. Compilation is a necessary first step to pass module structures to many analysis algorithms that take as input a ProductDESProxy.

    To use a module compiler, the user first creates an instance of this class, and configures it as needed. Then compilation is started using the compile() or compile(List) method, which returns the resultant product DES. The following code is used to compile a given module.

    try {
      ModuleProxyFactory modFactory = ModuleElementFactory.getInstance();
      OperatorTable optable = CompilerOperatorTable.getInstance();
      ProxyUnmarshaller<ModuleProxy> unmarshaller = new JAXBModuleMarshaller(modFactory, optable);
      DocumentManager manager = new DocumentManager();
      manager.registerUnmarshaller(unmarshaller);
      ProductDESProxyFactory desFactory = ProductDESElementFactory.getInstance();
      ModuleCompiler compiler = new ModuleCompiler(manager, desFactory, module);
      // configure compiler here if needed ...
      ProductDESProxy des = compiler.compile();
      // compilation successful, result in des ...
    } catch (EvalException exception) {
      // module has errors ...
    } catch (JAXBException | SAXException exception) {
      // error setting up XML parsers - should not happen ...
    }

    Algorithm:

    The input module is transformed to a product DES in the following five steps.

    ModuleInstanceCompiler
    Expands parameters bindings and foreach blocks, and loads and instantiates referenced modules.
    GroupNodeCompiler
    Expands transitions linked to group nodes into separate transitions.
    EFSMNormaliser
    Combines and renames events from different EFSMs, ensures that each event has a unique guard/action block throughout the module. (Only used if variables and guard/action blocks are present, and normalisation semantics is enabled by the setNormalizationEnabled(boolean) method.)
    EFACompiler
    Creates variable automata and expands guard/action blocks into separate events. (Only used if variables and guard/action blocks are present.)
    ModuleGraphCompiler
    Replaces the objects in the module hierarchy by the corresponding ProductDESProxy structure.
    Author:
    Robi Malik

    • Constructor Detail

      • ModuleCompiler

        public ModuleCompiler(DocumentManager manager,
                      ProductDESProxyFactory factory,
                      ModuleProxy module)
        Creates a new module compiler for the given module.
        Parameters:
        manager - The document manager used to load additional modules referred to by the module being being compiled.
        factory - The factory used to create the output product DES.
        module - The module to be compiled. This module is passed by reference into the compiler.

    • Method Detail

      • getInputModule

        public ModuleProxy getInputModule()
        Gets the module to be compiled by this compiler.

      • setInputModule

        public void setInputModule(ModuleProxy module,
                           boolean clone)
        Sets a new input module for the compiler. This method replaces the current input module and invalidates information from a previous compilation.
        Parameters:
        module - The module to be compiled.
        clone - Whether the input module is passed by reference or needs cloning. If true, the compiler creates a copy of the given module in order to compile the copy, enabling the caller to make changes to the original while the copy is being compiler. If false the given module reference is compiled directly, and it is the caller's responsibility to ensure that it remains unchanged while being compiled.

      • compile

        public ProductDESProxy compile()
                        throws EvalException
        Compiles the input module using default values for all parameter bindings.
        Returns:
        The product DES resulting from compilation.
        Throws:
        EvalException - to indicate any syntactical or semantical errors encountered during compilation. Using the setMultiExceptionsEnabled() method, the compiler may be configured to collect multiple error messages in a single exception (MultiEvalException), or to stop with an exception when the first error is encountered.

      • compile

        public ProductDESProxy compile(List<ParameterBindingProxy> bindings)
                        throws EvalException
        Compiles the input module using the given parameter bindings.
        Parameters:
        bindings - List of parameter bindings to supply values for parameters specified in the module. A module's event declarations (EventDeclProxy) and constant alias declarations (ConstantAliasProxy) may be declared as parameters, in which case the bindings can be used to supply values to replace these parameters.
        Returns:
        The product DES resulting from compilation.
        Throws:
        EvalException - to indicate any syntactical or semantical errors encountered during compilation. Using the setMultiExceptionsEnabled() method, the compiler may be configured to collect multiple error messages in a single exception (MultiEvalException), or to stop with an exception when the first error is encountered.

      • getSourceInfoMap

        public Map<Object,SourceInfo> getSourceInfoMap()
        Gets the source information resulting from the last compilation run.
        Returns:
        A map that assigns to objects in the output ProductDESProxy a source information record containing the object in the input ModuleProxy from which it was created, plus information about variable bindings. The generation of source information may be disabled by calling the setSourceInfoEnabled() method, in which case this method returns null.

      • getParametrizedName

        public static String getParametrizedName(ModuleProxy module,
                                         List<ParameterBindingProxy> bindings)
        Creates a name for a compiled module with its parameters appended in angle brackets.
        Parameters:
        module - The module being compiled.
        bindings - The list of parameter bindings, or null.
        Returns:
        A name string such as "factory<N=5>".

      • isOptimizationEnabled

        public boolean isOptimizationEnabled()
        Returns whether compiler optimisation is enabled.
        See Also:
        setOptimizationEnabled(boolean)

      • setOptimizationEnabled

        public void setOptimizationEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enables or disabled compiler optimisation. If enabled, the compiler may perform several optimisation steps to remove selfloops and unused events or automata from the output. This option is enabled by default.

      • isExpandingEFATransitions

        public boolean isExpandingEFATransitions()
        Returns whether guard/action blocks are compiled.
        See Also:
        setExpandingEFATransitions(boolean)

      • setExpandingEFATransitions

        public void setExpandingEFATransitions(boolean expanding)
        Sets whether guard/action blocks are compiled. If enabled, the compiler will compile guards and updates by replacing them with events. If disabled, guard/action blocks will be ignored (the EFACompiler will not be called). This option is enabled by default.

      • isNormalizationEnabled

        public boolean isNormalizationEnabled()
        Returns whether normalisation semantics is used.
        See Also:
        setNormalizationEnabled(boolean)

      • setNormalizationEnabled

        public void setNormalizationEnabled(boolean enabled)

        Sets whether normalisation semantics is used.

        If enabled, the compiler implements the semantics of a normalised EFSM system, using a first step to ensure that each event has a unique update associated with it. With this semantics the set of variables changed by a transition is determined after synchronous composition: variables that do not appear next-state variable in a guard/action remain unchanged unless composed with a transition in another EFSM that changes it.

        If disabled, an older semantics is used, where the set of variables changed by a transition is determined from EFSM containing it.

        This option is disabled by default.

        Reference:
        Sahar Mohajerani, Robi Malik, Martin Fabian. A framework for compositional nonblocking verification of extended finite-state machines. Discrete Event Dynamic Systems. September 2015. DOI: 10.1007/s10626-015-0217-y

      • isAutomatonVariablesEnabled

        public boolean isAutomatonVariablesEnabled()
        Returns whether automaton variables are enabled.
        See Also:
        setAutomatonVariablesEnabled(boolean)

      • setAutomatonVariablesEnabled

        public void setAutomatonVariablesEnabled(boolean enabled)

        Sets whether automaton variables are enabled.

        If enabled, the EFSM compiler recognises the names of automata (plant, spec, etc.) and their state names in guard expression to impose additional constraints on transitions. It is then possible to specify through a guard that a certain transition is only possible if a specific automaton is in a specific state.

        If automaton variables are enabled, the compiler must perform additional identifier checking. It is not allowed to use the same name for a variable and an automaton, or for a variable/automaton and a state. Duplicate identifiers are reported in case of such clashes. The additional identifier checking can be avoided by disabling automaton variables.

        Automaton variables are disabled by default. Automaton variables only work in combination with the normalising compiler, so the option has no effect if normalisation is disabled.

        See Also:
        setNormalizationEnabled(boolean)

      • isSourceInfoEnabled

        public boolean isSourceInfoEnabled()
        Returns whether the compiler generates source information.
        See Also:
        setSourceInfoEnabled(boolean)

      • setSourceInfoEnabled

        public void setSourceInfoEnabled(boolean enable)

        Sets whether the compiler generates source information.

        The source information records for each object in the output ProductDESProxy the object in the input ModuleProxy from which it was created, plus any variable bindings. It is used by the IDE to display error locations, and to highlight states and transitions during simulation.

        This option is disabled by default.

        See Also:
        getSourceInfoMap()

      • isMultiExceptionsEnabled

        public boolean isMultiExceptionsEnabled()
        Returns whether the compiler collects multiple error messages.
        See Also:
        setMultiExceptionsEnabled(boolean)

      • setMultiExceptionsEnabled

        public void setMultiExceptionsEnabled(boolean enable)
        Sets whether the compiler collects multiple error messages. If enabled, the compiler may continue after encountering an error. All errors encountered are collected in a MultiEvalException that is thrown at the end of compilation. If disabled, the compiler stops with a single EvalException on encountering the first error. This option is disabled by default.

      • getEnabledPropertyNames

        public Collection<String> getEnabledPropertyNames()
        Gets the set of enabled property names.
        See Also:
        setEnabledPropertyNames(Collection)

      • setEnabledPropertyNames

        public void setEnabledPropertyNames(Collection<String> names)
        Sets the set of enabled property names. If non-null, the compiler will check all property components to be generated (automata of type ComponentKind.PROPERTY) against the names in this collection, and suppress any that are not listed. The default for this option is null, which means to include all properties in the output.

      • getEnabledPropositionNames

        public Collection<String> getEnabledPropositionNames()
        Gets the set of enabled proposition names.
        See Also:
        setEnabledPropositionNames(Collection)

      • setEnabledPropositionNames

        public void setEnabledPropositionNames(Collection<String> names)
        If non-null, the compiler will check all proposition events to be generated (events of type EventKind.PROPOSITION) against the names in this collection, and suppress any that are not listed. The default for this option is null, which means to include all propositions in the output.

      • getHISCCompileMode

        public net.sourceforge.waters.analysis.hisc.HISCCompileMode getHISCCompileMode()
        Gets the current setting for partial compilation of HISC subsystems.
        See Also:
        setHISCCompileMode(HISCCompileMode)

      • setHISCCompileMode

        public void setHISCCompileMode(net.sourceforge.waters.analysis.hisc.HISCCompileMode mode)
        Configures the compiler for partial compilation of HISC subsystems. The default for this option is HISCCompileMode.NOT_HISC, which means that all components of a module hierarchy are compiled as a standard flat discrete event system.
        See Also:
        HISCCompileMode
